Package entitytype

Class EntityTypeSelectionFX

java.lang.Object
entitytype.EntityTypeSelectionFX
All Implemented Interfaces:
entitytype.EntityTypeSelection
public final class EntityTypeSelectionFX extends Object implements entitytype.EntityTypeSelection
JavaFX-aware data structure for managing the selection state of a set of JPA entity types, including configuration for prompt generation and string representation.

Uses BooleanProperty for each entity type to enable property binding and change observation in JavaFX-based user interfaces. Supports the same configuration and prompt assembly features as EntityTypeSelection, adapted for UI interaction.

Provides methods to select and deselect entity types, configure domain and database string generators, and assemble prompts for SQL query generation that include both domain and database context.

Author:
Felix Seggeb√§ing

    • EntityTypeSelectionFX

      public EntityTypeSelectionFX(Set<jakarta.persistence.metamodel.EntityType<?>> entityTypes)
      Creates a new selection object with all provided entity types initially selected, and sets up observable properties for use in JavaFX user interfaces.
      Parameters:
      entityTypes - the set of JPA entity types to manage; all will be pre-selected

  • Method Details

    • setDomainStringGenerator

      public void setDomainStringGenerator(entitytype.generator.DomainStringGenerator domainStringGenerator)
      Sets the DomainStringGenerator to use for generating the domain string representation.

      If not set, the default generator EntityTypeSelection.DEF_DOMAIN_STRING_GENERATOR is used.

      Specified by:
      setDomainStringGenerator in interface entitytype.EntityTypeSelection
      Parameters:
      domainStringGenerator - the generator to use

    • setDatabaseStringGenerator

      public void setDatabaseStringGenerator(entitytype.generator.DatabaseStringGenerator databaseStringGenerator)
      Sets the DatabaseStringGenerator to use for generating the database string representation.

      If not set, the default generator EntityTypeSelection.DEF_DATABASE_STRING_GENERATOR is used.

      Specified by:
      setDatabaseStringGenerator in interface entitytype.EntityTypeSelection
      Parameters:
      databaseStringGenerator - the generator to use

    • setPromptPrePostfix

      public void setPromptPrePostfix(String promptPrefix, String promptPostfix)
      Sets the prefix and postfix used for assembling prompts in SQL query generation.

      If not set, the defaults EntityTypeSelection.DEF_PROMPT_PREFIX and EntityTypeSelection.DEF_PROMPT_POSTFIX are used.

      Specified by:
      setPromptPrePostfix in interface entitytype.EntityTypeSelection
      Parameters:
      promptPrefix - the prefix to use in the prompt
      promptPostfix - the postfix to use in the prompt

    • getBooleanPropertyForEntityType

      public javafx.beans.property.BooleanProperty getBooleanPropertyForEntityType(jakarta.persistence.metamodel.EntityType<?> et)
      Returns the BooleanProperty associated with the given entity type, allowing selection state to be observed or modified in JavaFX.
      Parameters:
      et - the entity type for which the property is requested; must not be null
      Returns:
      the BooleanProperty for the given entity type
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if et is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if et is not managed by this selection

      Specified by:

    • getFullPrompt

      public String getFullPrompt(String prompt)
      Assembles the full prompt for SQL query generation by combining the configured prefix, the user-defined prompt, the postfix, the SQL dialect, the domain string, and the database string.

      The resulting prompt consists of: the prefix, the user-provided prompt, the postfix, a note on the current SQL dialect, the domain string (from DomainStringGenerator), and the database string (from DatabaseStringGenerator).

      Specified by:
      getFullPrompt in interface entitytype.EntityTypeSelection
      Parameters:
      prompt - the user-defined prompt content
      Returns:
      the complete prompt string including all configured and generated parts

      Checks whether all managed entity types are currently selected.
      Specified by:
      areAllSelected in interface entitytype.EntityTypeSelection
      Returns:
      true if all entity types are selected, false otherwise
